summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) form used to document warnings and assurances given to an employee being interviewed voluntarily as part of an investigation. The form includes a waiver section for the employee to sign, acknowledging the voluntary nature of the interview and that no coercion was used.
keyFacts: The document is a voluntary interview waiver form from the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG).
The form states the interview is voluntary, no disciplinary action will be taken for refusing to answer, and any statement may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The form includes a section for the employee to sign, waiving their rights and affirming no coercion was used.
The specific subject of the OIG investigation is not detailed in the provided text excerpt.
The form is part of the Epstein case document release, suggesting it relates to an OIG investigation connected to the Epstein matter.
